Authors: Xu Lu, Ting Cao, Thu Nguyễn Trang Thị, Haisheng Yuan
Title:
New species of Tomentella (Thelephorales, Basidiomycota) from
central Vietnam in Southeast Asia
Keywords:
ITS; Phylogenetic analysis; Resupinate thelephoroid fungi;
Taxonomy
Abstract:
Studies on taxonomy and phylogeny of Tomentella were
mainly reported in the temperate to boreal zones of the northern
hemisphere, but are scarce in tropical Asia. In this paper, six new
species from central Vietnam, T. albidomarginata, T. brevisterigmata, T.
cinereobrunnea, T. longiechinula, T. stipitobasidia and T. verrucospora,
were described and illustrated based on morphological characteristics
and molecular phylogenetic analyses of nuc rDNA ITS1-5.8S-ITS2 regions
combined with nuc 28S rDNA regions. All species can be recognized by a
combination of morphological features and anatomical characteristics.
Molecular phylogenetic analyses with maximum likelihood and Bayesian
analysis confirm the phylogenetic positions for these new species. New
species and closely related species in the phylogenetic tree are
discussed, and a key to species of Tomentella in Vietnam was
provided.
